content.title: Planck Pressure: The Maximum Meaningful Pressure in Physics
content.abstract: The Planck pressure P_P = c⁷/(ℏG²) ≈ 4.63 × 10¹¹³ Pa is the maximum pressure that classical physics can describe. It is equivalent to the Planck energy density and represents the equation of state P = ρc² at Planck density.

physical_significance.early_universe: During Planck epoch, P ~ P_P throughout universe
physical_significance.black_hole_interior: Pressure approaching P_P signals GR breakdown
